column5: I was out a week and a half ago at the cottage and the water temperature had finally broken 70 degrees getting the fish a little more active.  Smallmouth were relating to boulders and rock, and at the primary break to deeper water.  Soft plastics such as tubes and stick baits were producing as were topwater lures like Skitter Pops and Pop R's.  Here were the best two fish a 18" and a 20"er.  Sorry about the photo quality but I was solo and using my phone.
Nice smallies.Would love to fish for Haliburton smallies. If only the price of gas would come down!
ahh smallies, love the way they jump.  Nice going
Got to love smallmouth bass from that area, so clean and strong fighting fish!  Thanks for sharing, MTBF
Nice fish and thanks for sharing!
lol i'll pay for half your gas lets go! we'll wait till your thumb grows back tho
Nice smallies!  You need to grab the other 2 amigos from the hammer and we'll get out again.     Find it almost impossible to get Dave out these days.
Not sure about boat rentals in the area! My thumb should be good to go by Monday(hopefully)! Cant wait!
Nice smallies, I gotta get up to the Haliburton region at least once this season, the bronzeback fishery is outstanding from what I've seen and read.  Thanks for sharing

I think you can rent from most resorts in the area.  You can likely find places on Kashag, 12 Mile (Wedgewood Marina) and I think Hawk Lake marina rents as well. 705-489-2429.  The best bet might be to call Minden Live Bait 705-286-4826
